# from pyspark.sql.types import FloatType
# test = FloatType()
# test.jsonValue()

@logging_to_appins
def ingest_raw_to_standardised():
    '''
    Function reads all the schedules for all files, and processes any new files into standardised, and adds outstanding files into an outstanding files table
    Parameters:
    None

    Returns:
    None

    Actions:
    Processes files from raw to standardised based on a schedule, and will also keep track of files that haven't arrived and attempt to process those

    Exceptions:

    '''
    ###### module imports
    from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
    import logging
    spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
    import json
    from notebookutils import mssparkutils
    from pyspark.sql.types import StructType
    import pandas as pd
    
    ### create outstanding files table
    outstanding_files_table_json = spark.read.text("abfss://odw-config@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/orchestration/scheduling_outstanding_files_table.json", wholetext=True).first().value
    create_table_from_schema(outstanding_files_table_json, "odw_config_db", "raw_to_std_outstanding_files", "abfss://odw-standardised@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/", "config/raw_to_std_outstanding_files" )

    ### loads json for scheduling
    orchestration_json = spark.read.text("abfss://odw-config@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/orchestration/orchestration_test.json", wholetext=True).first().value
    json_config_dict = json.loads(orchestration_json)
    
    ###### process outstanding files
    outstanding_df = spark.read.format("delta").load("abfss://odw-standardised@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/config/raw_to_std_outstanding_files")
    if outstanding_df.count() > 0: # make sure there are entries in the outstanding files table
        outstanding_df_pd = outstanding_df.toPandas()
        for pdidx, pdrow in outstanding_df_pd.iterrows():
            time_now = pdrow['Expected_Datetime'] # use the expected from date as the pseudo 'today's date'
            outstanding_source_id = pdrow['DefinitionID'] 
            from datetime import datetime, timedelta
            # from zoneinfo import ZoneInfo tz=ZoneInfo("Europe/London")
            definitions = json_config_dict['definitions']
            for defs in definitions:
                if defs['Source_ID'] == outstanding_source_id: # isolate the correct scheduling config
                    standardised_container = defs['Standardised_Container'] + "/"
                    standardised_table_name = defs['Standardised_Table_Name']
                    standardised_path = defs['Standardised_Path'] + "/"
                    standardised_table_loc = defs['Standardised_Table_Definition']
                    standardised_table_def_json = spark.read.text(standardised_table_loc, wholetext=True).first().value
                    create_table_from_schema(standardised_table_def_json, "odw_standardised_db", standardised_table_name,standardised_container , standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
                    
                    cronstart = defs['Completion_Frequency_CRON']
                    deltadays = defs['Expected_Within_Weekdays']


                    from croniter import croniter
                    iter_start = croniter(cronstart, time_now)
                    last_start_dt = iter_start.get_prev(datetime) ### expected from
                    
                    next_end_dt = last_start_dt + timedelta(days=deltadays) ### expected to
                
                    # is the file expected right now?
                    if last_start_dt <= time_now < next_end_dt: 
                        standardised_table_df = spark.read.format("delta").load(standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
                        # check if the file has already been ingested
                        rows = standardised_table_df.filter((standardised_table_df.expected_from == last_start_dt) &  (standardised_table_df.expected_to == next_end_dt)).count()
                        if rows > 0 :
                            logging.info("File has already been ingested")
                        else:
                            source_container_path = defs['Source_Container_Path'] + "/"
                            source_folder =  defs['Source_Folder'] +"/"+ defs["Source_Frequency_Folder"] + "/"
                            # find correct weekly folder 
                            date_folders = mssparkutils.fs.ls(source_container_path+source_folder)
                            for date in date_folders:
                                date_string = date.path.split(source_container_path+source_folder)[1]
                                try:
                                    folder_date = datetime.strptime(date_string, "%Y-%m-%d")
                                except:
                                    try:
                                        ### make sure monthly json uses the penultimate day of a month
                                        folder_date = datetime.strptime(date_string, "%Y-%m")
                                        import calendar
                                        folder_date = datetime.date(folder_date.year, folder_date.month, calendar.monthrange(folder_date.year, folder_date.month)[-1])
                                    except:
                                        raise ValueError("Date format in raw folder is incorrect, should be YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM")
                                if last_start_dt <= folder_date < next_end_dt:
                                    source_folder_with_date = mssparkutils.fs.ls(source_container_path+source_folder+date_string)
                                    if source_folder_with_date == []:
                                        raise ValueError("Folder is empty")
                                    for file in source_folder_with_date:
                                        filename = file.path.split(source_container_path+source_folder+date_string)[-1]
                                        if defs['Source_Filename_Start'] in filename:
                                            if ".xlsx" in filename.lower():
                                                
                                                jobId = mssparkutils.env.getJobId()
                                                mssparkutils.fs.unmount("/temp_raw") 
                                                mssparkutils.fs.mount( 
                                                source_container_path+source_folder+date_string, 
                                                "/temp_raw", 
                                                {"linkedService":"ls_storage"} 
                                                )   
                                                df = pd.read_excel(f"/synfs/{jobId}/temp_raw/{filename}", dtype=str)
                                                rows_raw = len(df.index)
                                                mssparkutils.fs.unmount("/temp_raw") 
                                                sparkDF=spark.createDataFrame(df)
                                                from pyspark.sql.functions import lit
                                                sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("ingested_datetime",lit(datetime.now()))
                                                sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("expected_from",lit(last_start_dt))
                                                sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("expected_to",lit(next_end_dt))
                                                schema = StructType.fromJson(json.loads(standardised_table_def_json))

                                                import re
                                                cols_orig = sparkDF.schema.names
                                                cols=[re.sub("( |\#|\# |\.|\(|\)|\/)","_",i) for i in cols_orig] # replace chars with _
                                                cols=[re.sub("([\_]{2,})","_",i) for i in cols] #replace consecutive _ with one _
                                                cols=[re.sub("(\_)$","",i) for i in cols] #remove trailing _
                                                cols = [item.replace(',','').lower() for item in cols]
                                                for colix in range(len(cols_orig)):
                                                    sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumnRenamed(cols_orig[colix], cols[colix])

                                                from pyspark.sql.functions import col
                                                from pyspark.sql.types import StringType,BooleanType,DateType,TimestampType,IntegerType, FloatType
                                                mapping = {
                                                    'string': StringType(),
                                                    'timestamp': TimestampType(),
                                                    'integer': IntegerType(),
                                                    'date': DateType(),
                                                    'float': FloatType()
                                                }

                                                for field in json.loads(standardised_table_def_json)['fields']:
                                                    sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn(field['name'], col(field['name']).cast(mapping[field['type']]))
                                                colheaders = []
                                                for field in json.loads(standardised_table_def_json)['fields']:
                                                    colheaders.append(field['name'])
                                                sparkDF = sparkDF.select(colheaders)
                                                sparkDF2 = spark.createDataFrame(sparkDF.rdd, schema=schema)
                                                sparkDF2.write.format("delta").mode("append").saveAsTable(f"odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}")

                                                standardised_table_df_new = spark.read.format("delta").load(standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
                                                rows_new = standardised_table_df.filter((standardised_table_df.expected_from == last_start_dt) &  (standardised_table_df.expected_to == next_end_dt)).count()

                                                
                                                if rows_raw == rows_new:
                                                    mssparkutils.fs.mkdirs(source_container_path+"archive"+"/"+source_folder+date_string+"/")
                                                    mssparkutils.fs.mv(source_container_path+source_folder+date_string+"/"+filename,source_container_path+"archive"+"/"+source_folder+date_string+"/"+filename)
                                                    spark.sql(f"DELETE FROM odw_config_db.raw_to_std_outstanding_files WHERE Expected_Datetime = '{time_now}' and DefinitionID = {outstanding_source_id}")
                                                    logging.info('All rows have successfully written')
                                                else:
                                                    from delta.tables import DeltaTable
                                                    deltaTable_standardised = DeltaTable.forPath(spark, standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
                                                    fullHistoryDF = deltaTable_standardised.history()    # get the full history of the table
                                                    fullHistoryDF.select("version").first()['version']
                                                    deltaTable_standardised.restoreToVersion(fullHistoryDF.select("version").first()['version'] - 1)
                                                    raise ValueError(f"Incorrect number of rows have been written to the standardised table {standardised_table_name}, rolled back to original version")
                                                
                                            else:
                                                raise ValueError("This file type is unsupported")

    
    ### ITERATE THROUGH ALL JSON
    from datetime import datetime, timedelta
    # from zoneinfo import ZoneInfo tz=ZoneInfo("Europe/London")
    time_now = datetime(2022,11,4) # datetime.now() ### ingested_datetime
    definitions = json_config_dict['definitions']
    for defs in definitions:
        standardised_container = defs['Standardised_Container'] + "/"
        standardised_table_name = defs['Standardised_Table_Name']
        standardised_path = defs['Standardised_Path'] + "/"
        standardised_table_loc = defs['Standardised_Table_Definition']
        standardised_table_def_json = spark.read.text(standardised_table_loc, wholetext=True).first().value
        create_table_from_schema(standardised_table_def_json, "odw_standardised_db", standardised_table_name,standardised_container , standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
        
        cronstart = defs['Completion_Frequency_CRON']
        deltadays = defs['Expected_Within_Weekdays']


        from croniter import croniter
        iter_start = croniter(cronstart, time_now)
        last_start_dt = iter_start.get_prev(datetime) ### expected from
        
        next_end_dt = last_start_dt + timedelta(days=deltadays) ### expected to
    
        ### IS FILE EXPECTED RIGHT NOW?
        if last_start_dt <= time_now < next_end_dt: # always gonna be before midnight
            standardised_table_df = spark.read.format("delta").load(standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
            rows = standardised_table_df.filter((standardised_table_df.expected_from == last_start_dt) &  (standardised_table_df.expected_to == next_end_dt)).count()
            if rows > 0 :
                logging.info("File has already been ingested")
            else:
                source_container_path = defs['Source_Container_Path'] + "/"
                source_folder =  defs['Source_Folder'] +"/"+ defs["Source_Frequency_Folder"] + "/"
                # find correct weekly folder 
                date_folders = mssparkutils.fs.ls(source_container_path+source_folder)
                for date in date_folders:
                    date_string = date.path.split(source_container_path+source_folder)[1]
                    try:
                        folder_date = datetime.strptime(date_string, "%Y-%m-%d")
                    except:
                        try:
                            ### make sure monthly json uses the penultimate day of a month
                            folder_date = datetime.strptime(date_string, "%Y-%m")
                            import calendar
                            folder_date = datetime.date(folder_date.year, folder_date.month, calendar.monthrange(folder_date.year, folder_date.month)[-1])
                        except:
                            raise ValueError("Date format in raw folder is incorrect, should be YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM")
                    print(folder_date,last_start_dt,next_end_dt)
                    if last_start_dt <= folder_date < next_end_dt:
                        source_folder_with_date = mssparkutils.fs.ls(source_container_path+source_folder+date_string)
                        if source_folder_with_date == []:
                            raise ValueError("Folder is empty")
                        for file in source_folder_with_date:
                            filename = file.path.split(source_container_path+source_folder+date_string)[-1]
                            if defs['Source_Filename_Start'] in filename:
                                if ".xlsx" in filename.lower():
                                    
                                    jobId = mssparkutils.env.getJobId()
                                    mssparkutils.fs.unmount("/temp_raw") 
                                    mssparkutils.fs.mount( 
                                    source_container_path+source_folder+date_string, 
                                    "/temp_raw", 
                                    {"linkedService":"ls_storage"} 
                                    )   
                                    df = pd.read_excel(f"/synfs/{jobId}/temp_raw/{filename}", dtype=str)
                                    rows_raw = len(df.index)
                                    mssparkutils.fs.unmount("/temp_raw") 
                                    sparkDF=spark.createDataFrame(df)
                                    from pyspark.sql.functions import lit
                                    sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("ingested_datetime",lit(datetime.now()))
                                    sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("expected_from",lit(last_start_dt))
                                    sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("expected_to",lit(next_end_dt))
                                    schema = StructType.fromJson(json.loads(standardised_table_def_json))

                                    import re
                                    cols_orig = sparkDF.schema.names
                                    cols=[re.sub("( |\#|\# |\.|\(|\)|\/)","_",i) for i in cols_orig] # replace chars with _
                                    cols=[re.sub("([\_]{2,})","_",i) for i in cols] #replace consecutive _ with one _
                                    cols=[re.sub("(\_)$","",i) for i in cols] #remove trailing _
                                    cols = [item.replace(',','').lower() for item in cols]
                                    for colix in range(len(cols_orig)):
                                        sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumnRenamed(cols_orig[colix], cols[colix])

                                    from pyspark.sql.functions import col
                                    from pyspark.sql.types import StringType,BooleanType,DateType,TimestampType,IntegerType, FloatType
                                    mapping = {
                                        'string': StringType(),
                                        'timestamp': TimestampType(),
                                        'integer': IntegerType(),
                                        'date': DateType(),
                                        'float': FloatType()
                                    }

                                    for field in json.loads(standardised_table_def_json)['fields']:
                                        sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn(field['name'], col(field['name']).cast(mapping[field['type']]))
                                    colheaders = []
                                    for field in json.loads(standardised_table_def_json)['fields']:
                                        colheaders.append(field['name'])
                                    sparkDF = sparkDF.select(colheaders)
                                    sparkDF2 = spark.createDataFrame(sparkDF.rdd, schema=schema)
                                    sparkDF2.write.format("delta").mode("append").saveAsTable(f"odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}")

                                    standardised_table_df_new = spark.read.format("delta").load(standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
                                    rows_new = standardised_table_df.filter((standardised_table_df.expected_from == last_start_dt) &  (standardised_table_df.expected_to == next_end_dt)).count()
                                    if rows_raw == rows_new:
                                        mssparkutils.fs.mkdirs(source_container_path+"archive"+"/"+source_folder+date_string+"/")
                                        mssparkutils.fs.mv(source_container_path+source_folder+date_string+"/"+filename,source_container_path+"archive"+"/"+source_folder+date_string+"/"+filename)
                                        logging.info('All rows have successfully written')
                                    else:
                                        from delta.tables import DeltaTable
                                        deltaTable_standardised = DeltaTable.forPath(spark, standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
                                        fullHistoryDF = deltaTable_standardised.history()    # get the full history of the table
                                        fullHistoryDF.select("version").first()['version']
                                        deltaTable_standardised.restoreToVersion(fullHistoryDF.select("version").first()['version'] - 1)
                                        raise ValueError(f"Incorrect number of rows have been written to the standardised table {standardised_table_name}, rolled back to original version")
                                    
                                else:
                                    raise ValueError("This file type is unsupported")
                            else:
                                # needs to be upsert
                                outstanding_struct_schema = StructType.fromJson(json.loads(outstanding_files_table_json))
                                new_outst_file = spark.createDataFrame([[last_start_dt, defs['Source_ID']]], outstanding_struct_schema)
                                outstanding_df = spark.read.format("delta").load("abfss://odw-standardised@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/config/raw_to_std_outstanding_files")
                                outstanding_df = outstanding_df.union(new_outst_file).dropDuplicates()
                                outstanding_df.write.format("delta").mode("overwrite").save("abfss://odw-standardised@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/config/raw_to_std_outstanding_files")
                    else:
                        outstanding_struct_schema = StructType.fromJson(json.loads(outstanding_files_table_json))
                        new_outst_file = spark.createDataFrame([[last_start_dt, defs['Source_ID']]], outstanding_struct_schema)
                        outstanding_df = spark.read.format("delta").load("abfss://odw-standardised@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/config/raw_to_std_outstanding_files")
                        outstanding_df = outstanding_df.union(new_outst_file).dropDuplicates()
                        outstanding_df.write.format("delta").mode("overwrite").save("abfss://odw-standardised@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/config/raw_to_std_outstanding_files")
